item.title: Book Review: The Feminine Mystique
item.description: One of my biggest reading projects these past few months has been Betty Friedan’s The Feminine Mystique. I’ve always been interested in women’s psychology and feminism, so I was eager to deepen my understanding by reading this canonical work. It’s a very, very long and very convoluted book (the nature of the problem seems to ensure this, since Second Sex was equally difficult), but here’s a quick overview. The Mystique Friedan addresses the state of women during the 40s, 50s, and 60s, into the 70s, when many women gave up on pursuing an education and a career, denying all their aspirations but those related to raising a family.
